240.question: What was the performance of both approaches on their dataset?

4-Table4-1.png: Both approaches, i-vector and x-vector, had an EER(%) of 5.30 on the VoxCeleb dataset for the Front-end and 3.75 for the Back-end.</s>
Both the i-vector and x-vector systems trained on VoxCeleb achieved an EER(%) of 5.30 on their respective training sets.</s>

240.answer: ERR of 19.05 with i-vectors and 15.52 with x-vectors

242.question: What genres are covered?

2-Table1-1.png: The genres covered in the table are Entertainment, Interview, Singing, Play, Movie, Vlog, Live Broadcast, Speech, Drama, Recitation, and Advertisement.</s>
The genres covered in the table are Entertainment, Interview, Singing, Play, Movie, Vlog, Live Broadcast, Speech, Drama, Recitation, and Advertisement.</s>

242.answer: genre, entertainment, interview, singing, play, movie, vlog, live broadcast, speech, drama, recitation and advertisement

244.question: Which of the two speech recognition models works better overall on CN-Celeb?

4-Table4-1.png: The 'i-vector' model works better overall on CN-Celeb with an EER of 19.05%, compared to the 'x-vector' model which has an EER of 15.52%.</s>
The i-vector model works better overall on CN-Celeb with an EER of 19.05%, compared to the x-vector model which has an EER of 15.52%.</s>

245.question: By how much is performance on CN-Celeb inferior to performance on VoxCeleb?

4-Table4-1.png: The performance on CN-Celeb is 1.05% lower than on VoxCeleb.</s>
The performance on CN-Celeb is 19.05% for i-vector and 15.52% for x-vector, which is an improvement of 3.53% over VoxCeleb.</s>

245.answer: For i-vector system, performances are 11.75% inferior to voxceleb. For x-vector system, performances are 10.74% inferior to voxceleb
